page.title: 18ECOLOGY, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: This block contains several small patches of woodland, many planted after the Enclosure in the late 18th century.These contain a mixture of hardwoods, including English oak;beech -many of which have reached maturity or beyond;elm -the majority of these have been killed by Dutch Elm Disease in the last decade;ash trees; a few lime; horse-chestnut and sycamore trees. Self-set holly grows as under - brush in some spinneys. Yews and copper beech are grown in gardens. The County Council has recently planted a number of smaller trees, such as cherry,rowan,whitebeam,field maple and silver birch as ornamental trees. Haw- thorn and blackthorn were planted as field hedges after Enclosure. There are odd examples of more exotic species, such as Californian Redwood and other conifers.
